notes: #description

actor2: Police Forces of Greece (2019-) Units for the Reinstatement of Order
notes: On 4 February 2021, a group of anarchists, who had participated earlier in the day in the demonstration against the government's proposed bill on tertiary education reforms, clashed with police near the university campus in central Thessaloniki. The rioters hurled stones and petrol bombs at riot police, who responded with tear gas. There were damages to parked cars. There were 2 detentions and 1 arrest. [size=no report]

actor2: Police Forces of Greece (2019-) Units for the Reinstatement of Order
notes: On 4 February 2021, 3,500-5,000 students, teachers and parents demonstrated in Athens - Central Athens against the government's proposed bill on tertiary education reforms. Teachers also demanded the reopening of schools and universities with increased coronavirus protection measures. About 20 youths targeted ODOS, the newly established unarmed police force, hurling rocks, fire extinguishers and petrol bombs at them outside parliament. Riot police responded with tear gas and stun grenades. Another group hurled red paint at the Bank of Greece building. [size=3,500-5,000]

On 4 February 2021, students of Guru Nanak Dev University clashed with the police, in Amritsar (Punjab), during a demonstration demanding online examinations amid the ongoing coronavirus pandemic. 5 injured. [size=no report]

Property destruction: On 3 February 2021, suspected Fulani pastoralists burnt down a block of classrooms at the Government Secondary School Iluke in Kabba/Bunu LGA (Kogi). One suspect arrested. No reported loss of life or injury.

assoc_actor_2: VDP: Volunteer for Defense of Homeland
notes: On 3 February 2021, presumed ISGS militants attacked the village of Raogo (Pensa, Sanmatenga). Four people were killed, and a school and motorbikes belonging to volunteer fighters (VDP) burned.

On 3 February 2021, students demonstrated at the University of Saint Louis town (Rao, Saint Louis) against the closure of their university restaurant. They barricaded roads and clashed with the security forces (assumed Police Forces). [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, unidentified armed assailants triggered two bomb blasts at the premises of Muliwala Lower Primary School near Assam-Mizoram border (coded as Hailakandi, Hailakandi district, Assam). The school building, drinking water reservoir and a toilet were damaged.

On 3 February 2021, a group of students from the Students Family of Maritim Raja Ali Haji University (KM UMRAH) held a demonstration in front of their university's rectorate building in the Dompak sub-district, Bukit Bestari district, Tanjung Pinang City (Riau Islands province). They demanded tuition discounts during the coronavirus pandemic. They burned tires during the demonstration. [size=no report]

source: Pajhwok Afghan News; Afghan Islamic Press News Agency
notes: On 3 February 2021, 1 school principal was shot and killed by unknown gunmen in PD6 of Jalalabad city, Nangarhar.

On 3 February 2021, unspecified opposition representatives and activists organized a demonstration in Chkhorotsku, and attempted to enter the city hall building. A brawl started after the police stopped them. The demonstrators were angered by the alleged forcing of schoolchildren to clean the city hall toilets. [size=no report]

source: Sozcu; Bianet; Anadolu Agency; Human Rights Foundation of Turkey; Beyaz Gazete
notes: On 2 February 2021, around 100 demonstrators including students gathered in Kizilay quarter of Cankaya, Ankara in solidarity with the demonstrations of Bogazici University students in Istanbul against the appointment of a new president from outside the university via a government decree. Police intervened as the group attempted to march to the Cankaya municipality. Scuffles and struggles were reported between the police forces and some demonstrators that attacked police officers and also threw stones at them. Total 5 police officers and one demonstrator were injured. 83 demonstrators were detained. [size=around 100]

assoc_actor_1: Students (Turkey); TIP: Workers' Party of Turkey; HDP: Peoples Democratic Party; Government of Turkey (2016-); DISK: Confederation of Progressive Trade Unions of Turkey; Labour Group (Turkey)
source: A Haber; Karar; Human Rights Foundation of Turkey; Anadolu Agency; Beyaz Gazete
notes: On 2 February 2021, around 500 demonstrators gathered in Kadikoy town center, Istanbul in solidarity with the demonstrations of Bogazici University students in Istanbul against the appointment of a new president from outside the university via a government decree. Scuffles were reported between the riot police that intervened in the event with rubber bullets and tear gas and the demonstrators that attacked police vehicles by throwing stones. Student groups, DISK executives, TIP and HDP MPs attended the demonstration. 6 demonstrators were lightly injured due to rubber bullets and 94 others were detained by the police. [size=around 500]

On 2 February 2021, an unknown militant attempted to attack a school in Kirkuk city, but was wounded by a guard. Iraqi security forces responded by giving the militant chase and killing him on the Azadi intersection. 1 Fatality and no injuries.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)

The principal is facing charges related to his refusal to reopen the school amid the coronavirus infection peak in 2020. A man was injured. [size=no report]

On 1 February 2021, activists organized a demonstration in Chkhorotsku after an aledged news, that schoolchildren forced to clean the city hall toilets. The demonstrators attempted to enter the city hall building, but the police stopped them. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of the United States (2021-)
notes: On 27 January 2021, around 50-100 people, including members of Antifa, gathered for a Holocaust memorial which evolved into a demonstration at the ICE facility in Portland (Oregon) in support of abolishing ICE. Federal officers and police intervened and deployed munitions including pepper balls after people threw projectiles at Federal officers and set a dumpster on fire. One journalist reported being hit in the finger with munitions. Federal officers made one arrest. A nearby school requested that authorities stop using tear gas because it is seeping into the lawn that children play on. [size=around 50-100]

On 26 January 2021, at least 300-350 students staged a demonstration in Johar town neighborhood of Lahore - Iqbal (Lahore, Punjab) demanding online exams rather than on-campus exams amid the coronavirus pandemic. University security guards and police baton-charged the demonstrators. Police alleged that the demonstrators had set fire to the gate at University of Central Punjab and pelted stones at security guards while trying to enter the university premises. Several injuries were reported in the incident. At least 37 students were arrested. [size=at least 300-350]

On 26 January 2021, students pelted stones and staged a demonstration outside a university in Faisalabad city (Faisalabad, Punjab) demanding online rather than on-campus examinations amid the coronavirus pandemic. source: Twitter; Liveuamap; Washington Post; WCAU; USA Today; Forbes; WJZ13; ProPublica; Patriot-News; Fox45 (Baltimore); Committee to Protect Journalists; NBC12; Washington Examiner; Political Research Associates; WTKR3; WFMZ-TV; BuzzFeed; New York Times; CNN; US Press Freedom Tracker; WICU; WLTX News 19; MyTV Charleston; Winston-Salem Journal; MilitiaWatch; WITF; CBS17
notes: On 6 January 2021, thousands to tens of thousands of people demonstrated outside the Capitol in Washington DC (District of Columbia) to support President Trump and his allegations of voter fraud in the presidential election and to call for members of Congress to object to the certification of the Electoral College votes. The demonstrators included veterans, lawmakers, off-duty police officers, members of several militias and far-right groups (Sons of Liberty New Jersey, Groypers, Oath Keepers, Proud Boys, Boogaloo Boys, Three Percenters (III%), NSC-13), supporters of QAnon, and other groups, including 100 members of Moore County Citizens for Freedom and the organizers, The Silent Majority, and the Eighty Percent Coalition. Leading up to the event, President Trump hosted the 'Save America March' in front of the White House, calling for demonstrators to march to the Capitol building and 'fight like hell', while Rudy Giuliani, President Trump's personal lawyer, called for 'trial by combat.' Over 100 Republican lawmakers were planning to object to the certification of the electoral college votes on that day. 1 IED was found on the Capitol grounds. Around 1 pm, hundreds of rioters stormed and occupied the US Capitol Building for 4 hours, disrupting the certification and causing the evacuation of lawmakers from the Congressional chambers. It has been found that the Proud Boys were key instigators in storming the Capitol. When rioters pressed toward the Capitol, many Capitol Police officers simply retreated, not making any apparent effort to physically block rioters from gaining access to the Capitol building. One officer was even seen taking a picture with a rioter. Rioters outnumbered the Capitol Police, although there had been numerous warnings online about possible unrest. Some rioters scaled the sides of the Capitol building, broke windows, damaged doors and offices, and looted. One group constructed makeshift gallows in front of the Capitol. Rioters were tear-gassed, pepper-sprayed, and hit with pepper balls and smoke bombs by police. About 1100 troops from the National Guard were activated and deployed in the city by Vice President Mike Pence after the Capitol was breached. Some of the rioters inside the Capitol building had socks filled with metal objects and hit officers in the head, causing multiple injuries; others pepper-sprayed and hit officers and FBI agents with metal pipes and chemical irritants. Some rioters carried zip-tie handcuffs with them. Rioters assaulted and threatened at least 6 members of the media and destroyed media equipment outside. One journalist was hit with rubber bullets by rioters; others were briefly detained by police while covering the event. Two rioters and one police officer were killed as a direct result of the riot, while another two rioters succumbed to medical conditions. Of the rioters, Ashli Babbitt was shot by police while trying to climb through a broken door into the Speaker's Lobby, which would have given her access to the House of Representatives chamber. Another rioter, Rosanne Boyland, was reportedly trampled during one of the clashes between police and demonstrators outside the Capitol. Brian Sicknick, a Capitol Police officer, died after being dragged and beaten by rioters while defending the building. More than 50 police officers were injured, and at least 150 people have been arrested, including at least nine veterans and one woman who stole Nancy Pelosi's laptop with intent to sell it to Russian intelligence authorities. Members of Congress reconvened around 8pm to certify President-elect Joe Biden's Electoral College victory. After the riot, one US Capitol Police Officer committed suicide and multiple other officers have been reported as threatening self-harm. [size=thousands to tens of thousands] [stop the steal]

Around 50 students threw trash bins and projectiles and set two cars on fire. No fatalities or injuries were reported. [size=over 200]

On 18 September 2020, in Coyoacan, Ciudad de Mexico, a group of 20 hooded women set a security booth of the Mexico National Autonomous University on fire, looted offices, and destroyed two vehicles. The participants wrote messages demanding the freedom of a student who was arrested and demanding justice for cases of femicide. The looting started after a demonstration organized on the same grounds. [size=no report]

The demonstrators stated that the University has not been able to properly manage the exams and studies, even after six months into the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 18 September 2020, in Rio Largo, Alagoas, a man was killed in a drive-by shooting near a school in Mata do Rolo village by armed men on a motorcycle. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators nor crime motivation.

Around 17 September 2020 (as reported), in Macae, Rio de Janeiro, in the Miramar neighborhood, suspects invaded a public school and destroyed equipment. The City Hall reported that the school was targeted in similar previous actions, and that the suspects left tools of the invasion at the site.

On 16 September 2020, at least 20-25 rioters attacked and injured an office assistant and vandalized the Barisal Government Brojomohun College at Barisal city (Barisal). The reason of vandalism is yet under investigation. [size=at least 20-25]

On 16 September 2020, a large crowd gathered at the West Ibb Court, less than 1km northwest of Ibb University (Al Mashannah, Ibb) as the trial against the killer of two children commenced. The crowd become violent and attempted to attack the suspect and his lawyer as they entered the building. There were no reports of injuries. [size=no report]

Students threaten to disrupt private schools until public school teachers and the state reach an agreement. Students from one school attacked another school and the two groups clashed, throwing stones at each other. More than a dozen students were injured. [size=hundreds]

The FARDC also intervened. The Ngumino/Twiganeho reportedly raped 1 girl and killed between 7 and 10 civilians (including 4 women and 3 children). 8 civilians and 1 FARDC soldier were wounded. They also stole 100 cows and other animals and torched 250 houses. The local civilians fled towards Mikenge and more than 700 students could not undertake the final primary school-leaving exam. Fatalities split between two events in Ngezi and Bilalombili.

On October 30 2019, at the University of Carabobo, Valencia, members of the Pro-Capucha gang painted graffiti on the walls and destroyed part of the infrastructure demanding elections within the university to elect new authorities. It is reported that so far, universities have rejected the ruling of the Supreme Court of Justice to advance elections in universities. Some reports suggest that the Pro-Capucha gang is a pro-government group.

source: Wen Wei Po; RTHK; Ming Pao
notes: On 30 October 2019, nearly 200 students at the Hong Kong Design Institute in Tsung Kwan O, Sai Kung District (New Territories, Hong Kong) staged a sit-in on campus to ask to communicate with the university in relation to the death of a 15 year-old female student who allegedly had been arrested for participating anti-ELAB demonstration. The school agreed to hold a communication meeting with students earlier on the day, but failed to do so. The situation escalated as some students vandalised the campus and sprayed painted the school buildings with messages like 'hand out the CCTV'. The school later announced that it would be closed until 2 November. [size=nearly 200]

On 30 October 2019, in Gomez Palacio, Durango, a man who was allegedly caught showing his genitals at the exit of a school in Colonia 14 de Noviembre was about to be lynched by rioters who threw stones and glass bottles at him. The municipal police arrested the man. [size=no report]

On 2 Sep, two groups of students clashed at Guru Nanak Dev Engineering College (GNDEC) in Gill village (Ludhiana, Punjab). Although reports could not be confirmed, the clash is believed to be linked to ongoing conflict between local and non-local students, linked to the vandalism of a portrait of Sant Jarnail Singh Bhindrawala. [size=no report]

As reported on 2 September, a Hindu pilgrim resting in a school in Phalodi (Jodhpur, Rajasthan) was beaten up by villagers who suspected him to be a child lifter and later handed over him to police. [size=no report]

On September 2, armed men allegedly affiliated with Islah were reported to have executed a citizen with no legal justification in Al-Kala'ibah area of Taizz governorate, southwestern Yemen, where they reportedly turned a school into a prison and hold detainees outside of legal frameworks.
On 2 September, an Afghan national sustained minor face and hand injuries near the Athens University of Economics and Business when two people on a motorbike rode past and shot him with an air rifle.

Around 1 September 2019 (beginning of month), the vice chairman of political party Demosisto was beaten by three men outside his family home in Hong Kong after he helped to organise a school strike. On March 14th, students from Jebel Marra (who were sitting exams in Zalingei) rioted, and burned down several school buildings in Zalingei (Central Darfur). The motive is unclear. Security forces (coded as police) arrested four students. [size=no report]

14 March. Students from the Walter Sisulu University demonstrated over NSFAS allowances, demanding the money to be paid directly into students' accounts. Roads were blocked with burning objects [size=no report].
14 March. An unidentified armed group shot and killed a University of Nairobi student, who was working on citizen rights in Nairobi.
On Mar 14, a BCL leader was attacked and critically injured by Shibbir men with the use of sharp weapons at Madan Mohan College in Sylhet city.

On 14 March 2019, students demonstrated at the University of Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) following the killing of a student leader the night before. Hostel windows were broken by demonstrators. [size=no report]

14 March. The peaceful student demonstration at the University campus in Winneba against the dismissal of lecturers turned violent when rioters started to destroy property and threw stones at police forces. Police responded with teargas and warning shots. 10 people were injured.

On 14 March 2019, a man wielding two cleavers attacked 17 students outside a primary school in Tangshan City (Hebei) while they were waiting to be let in. The assailant, who was arrested at the scene, claimed that he had been 'forced to do so' by the former chief of the public security bureau. All the victims were hospitalised but none sustained life-threathening injuries.
14 March: A police officer shot and killed a school teacher in Kakamega for unknown reason

On 14 March 2019, an IED attached to a motorcycle by an unidentified armed group detonated at the 8th Azar roundabout near a school in Al Bab city in eastern Aleppo countryside, wounding 3 civilians including 2 women. No fatalities were reported.

On 13 March, 2019, Russian aircraft conducted airstrikes on Idleb city and its outskirts, impacting central station for transferring electricity, severely destroying it. The station went out of service, and also impacting a complex of administration facilities of Syrian Salvation Government, partially destroying the facilities and severely destroying their furniture, also impacting a dispensary, Idlib Center for Physiotherapy, Yousef al Azma Primary School partially destroying their buildings and damaging their furniture, and killing 17 including 8 children and 3 women and wounding over 49 others including 5 children and 19 women. Some sources reported the death toll at 15. Total fatalities coded to 17.

13 March. Students at the University of KwaZulu Natal broke windows and burned lecture rooms during a demonstration. One student was injured. Police was on the scene to calm the situation. [size=no report].

On March 13 2019, Israeli forces fired tear-gas canisters into an elementary school in Hebron city. The attack left a teacher and dozens of students suffering from tear-gas inhalation. Reports from eye witnesses claim that Israeli jeeps tried to run-over some of the students.

actor2: NAF: United Armed Forces of Novorossiya
source: OSCE SMM-Ukraine; LPR People's Militia Press Service; Lugansk Media Centre
notes: On 12 March, the Ukrainian Forces fired grenade launchers at the positions of the Luhansk People's Militia in the area of Zolote-5, Luhansk. The OSCE SMM observed a total of 30 projectiles/bursts of fire involving heavy machineguns/unknown weapons in both directions of the frontline near Zolote-5. Glazing of a functioning school was damaged by small arms fire. During the day, two LPR militants were killed and one was wounded at unspecified locations in Donbass [2 fatalities split among 3 events].

On 12 March, 2019, regime and loyalist militia fighters targeted, with artillery the town of Maaret Harma, impacting Primary School for girls, partially destroying its building and fence and damaging its furniture, and caused civilian casualties including one child. Fatalities coded to 0.
On March 12, 2019, in Cariacica, Espirito Santo, locals reported a drive-by shooting near a school. No fatalities.

On 12 March, during an ongoing demonstration on the campus of the MR Government College in Fazilka city (Punjab) students and a professor clashed. Students reportedly gheraoed and assaulted the professor and he along with other persons assaulted students. Both the professor and some students received injuries. [size=no report]

On 12 March 2019, in Morelia, Michoacan, students from the Michoacan normal superior school staged a demonstration by blocking an avenue in the sector, demanding changes in the directives assigned in the school. They captured 2 distributer trucks and blocked the avenue with them. [size=no report]

On 11 March, guest teachers of Delhi government schools who have been engaged in an ongoing demonstration, demonstrated outside the BJP office in New Delhi (NCT of Delhi) to demand the implementation of the 60-year-old policy. Demonstrators were detained by police and there were reports of minor scuffles during the process. [size=no report]

source: Ivoire Soir; Ivoire Times; Koaci News
notes: On March 11, in the morning, in Bekuefin village, a group of students blocked the road to Abengourou using tree trunks. They were demonstrating against the interruption of school, which has been ongoing for several weeks, following a national strike in the education sector. Rioters also reportedly broke car windows. [size=no report]

On Mar 11, panel leader for Dhaka University Central Students' Union (Ducsu) was allegedly assaulted by BCL activists at campus in Shahbagh, Dhaka city. He was rushed to hospital after falling unconscious. [size=no report]

source: Yemen Data Project; Yemen News Agency (SABA) - Pro-Houthi
notes: Anti-Houthi forces reportedly fired machine guns and artillery shells at the Engineering College, in the northern areas of Hodeidah city, with no report of fatalities nor injuries.
On 11 March, three families [size=small] objected to the demolition of their houses in Tirana and clashed with police in the area of Petro Nini high school. No injuries were reported.

On 10 March, an off-duty police sub-inspector and a school teacher were abducted by suspected Communist Party of India-Maoist (CPI-Maoist) cadres from Rewali village under Aranpur police station limits (Dantewada, Chhattisgarh). Both victims were released on March 11.
On 10 March, 2019, regime forces shelled the town of Tah, impacting Najib Arnous Primary School, partially destroying its building and damaging its furniture, with no injuries or fatalities reported.

On 10 March 2019, in Phatthalung's Pak Payoon district, there were six explosions: one explosion in a bicycle shop in tambon Pak Payoon; one explosion in a rubbish bin behind Anubal Pak Payoon School; one outdoor explosion in Pak Payoon; and an explosion inside a park near Phattalung train station. There was a bombing outside a plant-selling shop and also a bombing at an abandon house near the Pak Payoon Police Station. There was also the discovery of one suspicious bomb item behind a municipality sign in Pak Payoon. Later police reports allege the bombs were planted by Southern Muslim Separatists.

8 March 2019: A local schoolteacher from Tarim town of Hadhramawt was kidnapped by armed men. No further info.

On 7 March, Saudi-led coalition airstrikes reportedly targeted Bani Malik school in Kushar district, east of Hajjah border governorate, northwestern Yemen. No casualties reported.

On March 7, two groups of Trinamool Congress Chatra Parishad students clashed in Maulana Azad College in Kolkata city (Kolkata, West Bengal), over organising the college's festival later in the month. Four students were injured. [size=no report]

On March 7 2019, at least one person was shot during clashes happening between political groups in the town of Limbe, Bas-Limbe, Nord, Haiti, during an inter-school championship organized by a local political leader. Several people died during similar clashes at the end of 2018.

Rioters vandalised the school which led to the police intervene. Students had been demanding permission for the 54 students of Class X and XII to appear in ongoing board exam. [size=no report]

The demonstration became confrontational when officers from the state housing department came to seal the units and the tenants tried to stop the officers by blocking the entrances. Some of the residents were arrested for the disturbance. [size=22 families]

notes: On 6 March, a man was shot dead and three others injured in Sector 49 in Chandigarh city (Chandigarh) by unidentified persons. The attack is believed to be connected to a rivalry over control of the Indian National Student Organisation at DAV College.

Property seizure: On March 6, reportedly in a bid to crackdown proscribed organizations under the National Action Plan (NAP), the government agencies took over 31 schools, 16 madrassahs and 9 hospitals belonging to Jamaat-ud-Dawa (JuD) and Falah-i-Insaniyat (FIF) from Karachi, Hyderabad, Matiari, Jamshoro, Mirpukhas, Sanghar, Tando Allahyar, Badin, Tharparkar and other area of Sindh province (provincial capital coded) (Karachi, Sindh).

Property seizure: On March 6, government and law enforcement agencies took control over offices, schools and seminaries belonging to JUD and FIF in Quetta, Pishin, Chaman and Hub area of Balochistan province (provincial capital coded) (Quetta, Balochistan).

On 06 March, students of Magadh University burnt a Bihar State Road Transport bus in Gaya town (Bihar) during a demonstration against the delay in declaration of graduation results even after six months of examinations. Police used force to disperse the rioters. [size=no report]

On 6 Mar, in Kozhikode (Kozhikode, Kerala), a principal of the Government Medical College, including security staff, was assaulted by a Medical College Students' Union chairman and members during a demonstration on campus, demanding the principal to correct the minutes of a meeting which portrayed a particular session on the campus as 'anti-national.' source: GroundUp; Citizen (South Africa); African News Agency

On 6 March 2019, in Islas Huichas, Aysen, a group of fishermen demonstrated asking for overdue benefit payments related to the red tide period. They took over the docks, the airfield, schools and public services. At the end of the day, there was a clash between fishermen and a group of 20 naval officers. [size=no report]

On 6 March 2019, farmers and students staged a demonstration march from Halu Oleo University to the governor's office in Kendari city, Southeast Sulawesi province, to protest against the mining activity on the island of Wawonii. They managed to get into the courtyard of the building and the police responded by firing tear gas into the crowd, scattering the demonstrators. A video showed officers chasing down and thrashing a young demonstrator with iron rods. The total injured included four policemen, four students and three farmers from Wawonii. [size=no report]

On March 6, students of MA journalism and mass communication staged a demonstration and kept their teachers confined in Jadavpur University, in Kolkata city (Kolkata, West Bengal), alleging anomaly in evaluation of answer scripts. [size=no report]

source: SHAM; SNHR; SOHR; White Helmets; Liveuamap

On March 4th, students burnt down parts of a school at an unspecified location in Koro sub-district (Omoro district), in protest at the removal of three staff members, and inadequate rations. Seven students were subsequently arrested.

As reported on 2 March 2019, in Cardenas (Tabasco), two suspects on a motorbike kidnapped a young student outside school and managed to escape. No further information on the whereabouts of both the captors and victim was reported.

On 23 Feb, in Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Telangana), parents and students of the Maheshwara Medical College and Hospital staged a strike and demonstration at the Patancheru campus and forcibly closed down the hospital to express the disappointment for the delays in resumption of classes at the College. On February 23, a remote-controlled explosion targeted a vehicle of security officials on a routine patrolling mission near Golden Aero School in Mir Ali town (North Waziristan, KP), injuring three security personnel.

actor1: Police Forces of Afghanistan (2014-) National Directorate of Security
notes: On 22-February-2019, local sources claimed that at least 18 civilians were killed and 1 school, 1 mosque, and 3 houses were destroyed in operations conducted by National Directorate of Security and Afghan Military Forces in Wardak province. The Afghan Ministry of Defense claims that 18 militants were killed and the Taliban claims that 20 civilians were killed.

On Feb 22, at least 10 people were injured in a clash between two rioting factions of BCL at Chittagong university, Fatehpur (Hathazari, Chittagong). The clash ensued when the news about abduction of one of the CU leader of BCL spread.

On 22 Feb 2019, a former state television talk show host who was unable to be contacted and had not posted any social media updates was suspected to be kidnapped by state forces for at least a week before reappearing at the Communication University of China in Chaoyang (Beijing). The talk show host had been involved in a whistleblowing case regarding documents being stolen from a Supreme Court judge's office for a 100 billion yuan mineral ownership case. There was no official statement about his whereabouts during his 'disappearance'.
On 22 Feb 2019, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a boy after he left school in zone 12 of Guatemala City. According to police, the attack could be related to gang disputes.

On 22 February 2019, about 10 college students vandalized the Chiang Kai-shek statue on the National Chengchi University campus in response to a vandalism on the 228 Peace Memorial committed by a pro-China group. [size=about 10]

source: Globe and Mail; Xinjiang Victims Database
notes: Around 22 February 2019 (within 2 weeks from 15 Feb), a Uyghur high school principal and literature teacher disappeared incommunicado from Artux county (Kizilsu Kyrgyz Autonomous, Xinjiang), and was suspected to be taken away due to having family connections abroad. On 26 May 2019, his daughter in Canada was able to contact him and confirmed that he was no longer in camp, but after that call, he changed his decade-long phone number and could not be reached for six months.
On 22 February, 2 Saudi-led coalition airstrikes reportedly targeted a school in Al Masabih area of Qarah district, east of Hajjah border governorate, northwestern Yemen. No casualties reported.
On 22 February 2019, in Huimanguillo (Tabasco), a former police man was shot and killed by people inside a car, while he was riding his motorcycle to pick up his son at school. 1 fatality.

On 21 February 2019, students of Pokhara University vandalised university building and vehicles in Pokhara city (Kaski district), alleging anomaly during result publication of engineering seven semester. [size=no report]

On February 21, a security guard returned fire at an unidentified armed man when he opened fire at a primary school for girls in Bhatt village near Haripur city (Haripur, Punjab). No fatalities or injuries reported.

On 21 February, 2 Saudi-led coalition airsrtikes reportedly targeted Bani Shar and a school in As Sawdah area of Khayran al Muharraq district, east of Hajjah governorate, northwestern Yemen. No casualties reported.

On 21 February, 2019, the Military Forces of Syria artillery shelled a school for girls, partially damaging its fence in Andan, and a main road near the town in northern Aleppo countryside. Neither fatalities nor injuries were reported.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
notes: On February 21, presumed JNIM and/or ISGS militants burned the school in Toudeni (Ountadini) and looted the cantine.

source: Ma'an News Agency; Palestine News and Information Agency

Israeli Settlers threw rocks and Soldiers fired tear-gas at Palestinian students as they were leaving the school. Settlers also attacked a number of Palestinian owned houses in the area and smashed the windows.

On Feb 21 2019, Israeli forces together with Israeli Settlers, attacked an elementary school in the Old City of Hebron, in the southern occupied West Bank with tear gas canisters. At least 30 students suffered from tear-gas inhalation and one is in critical condition.

actor1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services

Six of the detained were released that night. On Feb 18th, NISS also detained a Darfuri student activist in Khartoum.

On 21 February 2019, in Tuxtla Gutierrez (Chiapas), a group of alleged students of the Rural Teaching School CENECH Mactumatza used vehicles of public transportation to block a road and later set them on fire on. [size=no report]

As reported on 21 February 2019, in Macuspana (Tabasco), two men on a motorcycle shot and killed a man who was taking his 4 year-old grandson to school. The motivation of the crime is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 20 Feb, in Yavatmal city (Yavatmal, Maha), at least two Kashmiri students from Dayabhai Patel College were repeatedly slapped, punched, and were forced to say pro-India remarks by Yuva Sena activists (youth wing of Shiv Sena) in relation to the Pulwama attack in J&K. The attackers were later arrested and suspended from the party.
As reported on 20 February 2019, in Ciudad Madero (Tamaulipas), a man's body was found in different bags inside a pit behind a school. There is no further information about the crime. 1 fatality.

actor2: ULA/AA: United League of Arakan/Arakan Army
notes: On 20 February 2019, near Minbu Village, in Rathedaung Township, in Rakhine State, fighting broke out between AA and Myanmar's military. One other girl was injured and two villagers were taken away by the military

On 20 February 2019, a human rights defender and former university lecturer from Shanghai was kidnapped by 'stability maintenance agents' from the sub-district office after petitioning in Beijing. The officials held him in a black jail in Hengsha Island, Chongming District (Shanghai) until 15 March 2019, during which they beat him up and broke 4 of his ribs.

On 20 February 2019, in San Juan, San Juan, workers from a graphics co-op demonstrating against irregularities in government textbooks for school engaged in violence with police who responded to an unofficial demonstration. Demonstrators attacked the police, and two officers were injured. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: UPDF: United People's Democratic Front; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: On Feb 19, a college student believed to be involved with UPDF was shot and killed by unidentified assailants in red square area of Khagrachhari city (Chittagong).

On 19 February 2019, three residents of Siodorejo subdistrict when exiting the Medan State University in North Sumatra in Medan city, North Sumatra were stopped by security guards after being accused of stealing the helmets of two people who had previously reported the theft. They refused to let their motorbike be checked. This led to four security guards and seven others, some of which are students, beating them severely. One died at the security post, the other on the way to the hospital. [size=11]

On 19 February, 2019 in Cadereyta Jimenez, two men were shot, one of them killed by a shot to the head, in front of a school when two armed men came out of a car and shot them, in an attack apparently related to organized crime.
On 19 February, 2019 in Zongolica, Veracruz, the former municipal president, now school teacher, was kidnapped for ransom. There was no more information about his condition or whereabouts.

On February 19, two groups of students, one including members of Trinamool Congress Chhatra Parishad, clashed in Jadavpur University in Kolkata city (Kolkata, West Bengal), when a section of students were demonstrating demanding elections to the student bodies. The Vice Chancellor and teaching staff were pushed during the fight. [size = no report]
On or around 19 February 2019, a teacher at a primary school in Ksour Essaf was assaulted by security forces in front of his students.

On 18 February 2019, after being accused of theft, an Islamic boarding school student died from injuries after he was beaten and abused by 19 of his fellow students for a period over three days in Padang city (Padang, West Sumatra). He was hospitalized in a coma for more than a week before he passed.

On 18 February 2019, students staged a demonstration and used rocks and bricks to block the entrance to Mangosuthu University of Technology. Police used teargas to disperse the crowds and arrested seven. The rioting students demanded financial aid and accommodation. [size=no report]

On February 18, a student of Adana Science and Technology University was attacked and heavily wounded by a group of alleged Grey Wolves members in Saricam, Adana as he objected to the decision to change the university's name after MHP Leader Alparslan Turkes. [size=no report]

18 February. Rioting pupil from Nkiliji High School forced teachers to lock themselves in their storerooms. The pupil also threw stones at some of the teachers and damaged property. The police intervened to calm the situation. The riot came after the principal announced that all sporting activities will be banned. [size=no report]

On February 18, one Higher Secondary Student from Ledu College was severely beaten up by the public in Ledo city (Tinsukia, Assam), for posting 'Pakistan Zindabad' (Long Live Pakistan) on his Facebook profile, making a reference to the attack by Pakistan-backed militants in Kashmir's Pulwama district, on February 14.
On Feb 18, four photo journalists were beaten by rioting activists of BCL when they tried to take photos of an on-going clash at MC College in Sylhet.
On Feb 18, 37 people were injured including two policemen when two rioting factions of BCL clashed at Jagannath university (Sutrapur, Dhaka) over establishing supremacy.

Classes at the Durban University of Technology have been disrupted by protesting Economic Freedom Fighters Student Command members (EFFSC) who chased students out of their classes. The protest was said to be in honour of an EFFSC member killed during a violent protest. [size=no report]
18 February. Students from the University of KwaZulu-Natal have burned their mattresses in protest against their bed in their university residence being uncomfortable. [size=no report]

17 February. Buildings and vehicles were burned at the University of Zululand's KwaDlangezwa Campus by rioting students, who demanded answers over their allowances and tuition fees not being paid. Police arrived at the scene, attempting to diffuse the situation. Some injuries have been reported. Size of demonstration unknown.
On Feb 17, activists of BCL beat up a student at Chittagong university, Fatehpur (Hathazari, Chittagong) on suspicion of him being an activist of ICS.
On 17 February, 2019, regime forces shelled the town of Babuline impacting Martyr Omar Al Ulwan School, severely damaging its fence, with no injuries or fatalities reported.

On 17 February, 2019, the regime forces shelled the town of Ma'arrat An Nu'man, targeting civilian areas, houses and a local market known as Al Khudar Market, burning several shops and severely damaging them, with surface to surface missiles, and shells fell near Abdul Karim Ramadan School in al Janoubi neighborhood, partially damaging its fence, and also killed between 1 to 5 civilians and injured 7 others.

On February 17, 2019 in Tuxtla Gutierrez, Chiapas, a group of students from rural schools blocked roads, vandalized vehicles with passengers and cargo, taking over at least three vehicles, and emptying at least six trucks of their load. [size=no report]

16 February. Unidentified armed group kidnap over 100 students and some teachers from St. Augustine College in Kumbo of Jakiri, releasing them a day later following negotiations to shut down the school.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
notes: On February 16, presumed JNIM and/or ISGS militants burned a school in Timambadi (coded as Namounou at geoprecision 2).

She had ran away from home after threats from neighbours. She was later booked by the police.

actor2: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: On 16 February, coalition backed Hujur tribal militias reportedly destroyed 2 pro-Houthi armored vehicle in Aflah ash Sham area of Kushar district, northeast of Hajjah border governorate, northwestern Yemen, killing 10 pro-Houthi elements that were on board. notes: Mortar attacks launched by unidentified assailants hit an elementary school at Barangay Tanum, Patikul town, Sulu province on February 16, 2019. No one was wounded.

Between 16 - 17th February 2019, the body of a LGBT student of the Autonomous University of Mexico City was found in the street Oriente 166, in Cuauhtemoc, Mexico City. Students link the event to a hate crime, although perpetrator and motive remain unknown.

assoc_actor_1: EFFSC: Economic Freedom Fighters Students Command; SASCO: South Africa Students Congress; Students (South Africa)

The protest was in response to NSFAS allowances not being paid and tuition and postgraduate registration fee increases. The Economic Freedom Fighters Student Command and the South African Students' Congress led the protests.

On February 15, 2019 in Bar, Montenegro, citizens held a protest over the construction of a kindergarten in the backyard of a high school, which the police dispersed, violently removing a pregnant woman from the site of the protest, after which she lost the baby. Citizens continued the protest in the afternoon, and later in the night, turning it into a protest against police brutality.

On February 15, around 30 students beat up another student from the National Institute of Technology (NIT) inside the college hostel in Durgapur city (Paschim Bardhaman, West Bengal), over a social media post about the attack by Pakistan-backed militants in Kashmir's Pulwama district, on February 14.
On February 15, IJeT activists allegedly assaulted a student of the Hailey College of Commerce, Punjab University in Iqbal town (Lahore, Punjab).

On 15 Feb, in Bengaluru city (Bengaluru Urban, Karnataka), three Kashmiri students beat up a fellow collegemate (Koushik Debnath) when the latter questioned their social media (Facebook) post supporting the Pulwama attack in J&K. The 3 were later arrested on charges of assault and spreading of hateful messages on social media.

Reports of tires burnt and people prevented from entering schools. Workers demand full time employment. Workers said that nine of their members were shot by police.

On Feb. 15 2019, a group called Anarchists damaged several glass panes and desks at the ELTA (post office) branch in the Aristotle University of Thessaloniki campus just after opening time and then fled. They claimed responsibility on Feb. 22 and expressed their solidarity with a jailed robber with suspected ties with urban guerrilla groups, who has been on hunger strike for more than a month.
On Feb 14th 2019, in Buenavista Michoacan, an armed clash between two unidentified armed groups affected a local school, the shooting lasted around 45 minutes and none of the students was injured.
On 14 February 2019 in Yuriria (State of Guanajuato), the decapitated body of a man was found near the University of Guanajuato campus. Next to the body there was a threatening message. 1 fatality

On 14 February 2019 in San Luis Potosi (State of San Luis Potosi), while parked outside a primary school waiting for his daughter, a man was shot and killed by two unidentified armed attackers in the Prados de San Vicente Tercera Seccion neighbourhood. 1 fatality.

On Feb 14 2019, clashes broke out between Israeli forces and Palestinian students in Hebron City near the Tariq ibn Ziyad school, as Israeli forces stormed the area. Dozens of Palestinian students suffered from tear-gas inhalation.
13 February (on or before). Disarmed Nsapu militia members occupied the Kamako primary school and imposed taxes and arbitrary arrests on the civilian population in Kamako.

On Feb 13, two armed groups of BCL activists clashed at Jahangirnagar University (Savar, Dhaka) following a previous enmity. Eight people were injured in the clash.

On 13 February, 2019, the regime forces shelled Khan Shaykun in the south-eastern countryside of Idleb near a civil defense center which was established in a cave in al Sharqi neighborhood, and shelled on Martyr Ahmad Al Yousef High School for girls, killing 2 men and wounding 10 others.

Students also protested at their residences over the shortage of accommodation. Stones and bottles were thrown by student to gain entrance to the residence. One of the students explained that the decision was taken because exams were approaching and they did not want to lose the academic year. notes: Between January 21 and January 22, 2019, in Itarema, Ceara, a group set two municipal schools on fire as a response to the enforcement of stricter rules in Ceara prisons. According to ongoing investigations, criminal factions operating in Ceara - PCC, CV and GDE - would have joined forces to retaliate the statements on prisoners' division made by the new state penitentiary secretary.

On 20 Jan, in Kolhapur city (Kolhapur, Maha), around 20 men from the Yuva Sena, the youth wing of the Shiv Sena, ransacked the school principal's office of the Holy Cross Convent High School after parents were asked for an additional Rs 7,000 per student in the junior kindergarten as building fund. 15 people were arrested.
On Jan 20, unidentified group of men attacked a top-level leader of BCL at Rajshahi university in Rajshahi district and sevrerly injured him after stabbing.

On January 20, election agents of political parties and candidates vandalized furniture at Don Bosco School in Haflong city (Dima Hasao, Assam), alleging rigging of votes by supporters of the ruling BJP during North Cachar Hills Autonomous Council elections. A LED display of CCTVs installed outside the strong room had been switched off, fuelling fear of rigging. The police intervened to control the mob.
On January 20, a number of flexes and flags of Trinamool Congress were damaged by unidentified men inside the Jadavpur University campus near gate number 4, in Kolkata city (Kolkata, West Bengal).

On 20 January 2019, in the neighbourhood Granjas Mexicos, Ciudad de Mexico-Iztacalco, three university students were allegedly arbitrarily detained and tortured by the SSP Police. After the students refused to comply with a supposedly unconstitutional attempt of arrest, the police men started beating them made up false charges. 3 injuries.
19 January. Al Shabaab has allegedly abducted dozens of school children near Tiyeglow town, Bakool.

On 19 January 2019, four assailants punched and kicked a well-known activist near Thammasat University in Bangkok city, after he was returning from a protest demanding that the government should hold elections without further delays.

On 19 January 2019, in Zamora de Hidalgo, Michoacan, a man was shot by individuals in a car on Juarez Avenue, in front of the Municipal Public Security Department. In the middle of the attack a university student was hit by a 'lost bullet.' also, a man was killed in a drive-by shooting while walking on a street in Colonia San Ramon. The attackers were riding a motorcycle. 1 fatality, 2 injuries.

actor2: Police Forces of Greece (2015-2019) Units for the Reinstatement of Order
notes: On Jan. 19 2019 since before midnight and until 2 a.m., a group of hooded people targeted the MAT riot police units that are stationed outside the National Technical University of Athens (Polytechnio) throwing Molotov cocktails bombs. There were no injuries, detentions or arrests reported.

actor2: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: On 19 January, anti-Houthi forces reportedly fired artillery at a pro-Houthi position in Al Rawd school in At Tayziyyah district, west of Taizz city, central Yemen, killing 9 pro-Houthi fighters including commanders.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
notes: On 18 January 2019, in Campo Grande (MS), an armed group engaged in an armed confrontation with the Shock Battalion of the Military Police, after the group had committed an armed robbery in near the Federal University of Mato Grosso do Sul (UFMS). During the shootings, two armed suspects were shot and killed and another one escaped.

On January 18, students from Islamia College Civil Lines clashed with a traffic police official and later staged a demonstration by blocking the road outside the office of the Chief Traffic Officer in Data Gunj Buksh town (Karachi, Sindh), against alleged misbehaviour of the traffic warden.

On January 18, locals blocked the road with stones and burnt materials in Pirukudi under Khajuripada police limits area (Kandhamal, Odisha), after a JCB excavator ran over two school students killing them on the spot. The locals demanded compensation for the families of the deceased and arrest of the JCB driver.

As reported on January 18, 2019 in Vukovar, Croatia, a Serbian high-school student was attacked by a group for 'not standing up when the Croatian anthem is playing', causing discussion in the media and among politicians in Serbia and Croatia.

On 18 January 2019, students at the preparatory school in Kondar refused to enter the school and demanded to take the exams. Some of them deliberately attempted to attack the educational institution which led to the dispatch of a security patrol to protect it.

actor2: NAF: United Armed Forces of Novorossiya
notes: On 17 January 2019, a building of a functioning school was damaged by small arms fire due to an armed clash between the Military Forces of Ukraine and NAF rebel forces in Zolote-5, Luhansk. The OSCE SMM observed a total of 2 projectiles involving unknown weapons near Zolote-5.

17 January. A school teacher was shot and wounded in Mogadishu by unknown assailants. The perpetrators escaped.

Anti-Houthi forces reportedly fired heavy and medium weapons toward Hodeidah University in the south of the city, western Yemen, with no report of casualties.
On 16 January 2019, in Ometepec (Guerrero), a minor was abducted by armed men when leaving the school. The girl was rescued on 23 January 2019 and the kidnappers were arrested.

On Jan. 16, 2019: Students continued demonstrating for educational reform by staying barricaded in the Aleksander Xhuvani University in Elbasan. Students said they were threatened by professors to receive absense notes unless they returned to lectures, which violated the Dean's order.
On Jan. 16, 2019: Students continued demonstrating for educational reform by staying barricaded in the Polytechnic University in Tirana, disrupting lectures until their demands would be fulfilled.
16 January. Unidentified armed group attack a school in Limbe of Fako. Coded as VAC pending more information.

On Jan 16, at least two activists of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) were injured when two rioting factions clashed over establishing supremacy at Manikganj Government Devendra College campus in Manikganj, Dhaka.

In the middle of the week starting on 13 January 2019, a group of protesters in Kamour closed the road and burned tires to demand a elementary school in the town.

Total fatalities coded to 15, with 1 fatality for the suicide bomber.

Within the month of Jan, in Munnad area (Kasaragod, Kerala), a group of Congress workers assaulted a CPM worker (Peethambaran) in connection with the issues at the People's Co-Operative Arts and Science College. No other information was provided. Other sources cited it happened on the first week of Feb.
On Jan 14 in the evening and Jan 15 in the morning, in Saint Louis, students from Gaston Berger University blocked the National Road 2, to protest against the delay of scholarships payment.

Workers in municipalities who lack job security also demonstrated with the teachers. Traffic in central Athens was disrupted. When dozens to hundreds of demonstrators tried to break through a police cordon attacking officers, riot police used tear gas and stun grenades to disperse them. No injuries or arrests were reported.

On 14 Jan 2019, members from the unions of the Autonomous National University Benito Jurez de Oaxaca blocked the roads in Oaxaca de Juarez using burning tires. The reason for the blockage is unknown. [size=no report]

On 14 January, the former rector of a Kyiv medical university and her supporters demonstrated outside the administrative building of the university in Kyiv against her suspension. They broke into the university building and caused a fight. The police escorted the demonstrators outside. [size=no report]

Two separatists were killed. A volunteer ranger and an eight-year-old child were slightly injured.
On 12 January, anti-Houthi forces reportedly fired 6 mortar shells toward the University in Al Hali district of Al Hudaydah city, western Yemen. No casualties reported.

A few dozen demonstrators tried to force their way into Parliament; riot police fired tear gas to stop them and two people were injured by stun grenades. No arrests were reported.

The policemen were there to crack down on illegal vendors operating in the area when the police van was attacked and the driver was injured in his arm when hooded assailants came at him with clubs and hammers. He fired warning shots to disperse the attackers. 3 to 11 people were detained.

source: Ansar Allah; Yemen Data Project; Al Masirah

notes: 10 January. SLECG and government negotiations fail over salary discussions, leading to riots in Labe with stones thrown at schools and other students. Police intervene to disperse the rioters.

On January 10th, armed men attacked a truck carrying provisions the Dr John Garang University, in the area of Bed-Laku near Mangalla (Central Equatoria). A police officer who was accompanying the truck exchanged fire with the attackers, and was wounded in the process. The officer is to be taken to Juba for treatment.

10 January. Armed Ambazonian separatists and military forces clash in Kumba of the South West region near a local school, wounding three soldiers and killing and wounding 'several' separatists. 'Several' killed and wounded coded as 10.

On 10 Jan, two factions of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) at Jagannath University (JnU) in Dhaka city clashed, leaving at least ten of their activists injured. Posts on Facebook and establishing supremacy were the reasons behind the clash.

On Jan 10, in San Cristobal, Tachira state, demonstrations were recorded at various points. The accesses to the University of the Andes (ULA) were blocked. In other zones, citizens concentrated to reject the swearing in of Nicolas Maduro as president. The headquarter of the University showed placards that said 'Maduro usurper', 'We declare ourselves in civil disobedience', 'the street is the exit'. Students placed barricades to prevent access to the place, burned tires, and declared themselves in disobedience.

actor2: Military Forces of Thailand (2014-2019) Volunteer Defense Corps
notes: On 10 January 2019, in tambon Prachan (Yarang, Pattani) about eight armed men dressed like soldiers (suspected separatists) opened fire on defence volunteers at Bukoh school. Four defence volunteers were killed.
On January 9, unidentified people threw rocks at a college van and shattered the windows injuring some students inside the van, in Kasur town (Kasur, Punjab).

On Jan. 9, 2019: Albanian students barricaded themselves at the Polytechnic University in Tirana and demonstrated, demanding education reform. While some students tried to move chairs and tables out of the university, they clashed with university guards. No injuries were reported.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
notes: Property destruction: On 9 January 2019, presumed ISGS or JNIM militants attacked a school in Touodjamoanli village, in Logobou commune (Logobou, Tapoa). The militants gathered the students, and seized and burned their school materials.

On 09 January, 2019, National Army of opposition shelled with mortar the town of Atmah in Idleb countryside, which impacted Abnaa Al Sham school, partially damaging its building. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.

On 8 Jan 2019, in Phong Sakho in tambon Mo Mawi (Yarang, Pattani), a bomb detonated in front of a local non-formal education center. It is suspected that it was planted by Southern Muslim Separatists. A private and a 12-year-old schoolgirl were injured.

assoc_actor_1: CITU: Centre of Indian Trade Unions; AITUC: All India Trade Union Congress; Labour Group (India); AIUTUC: All India United Trade Union Centre; INTUC: Indian National Trade Union Congress; CPI(M): Communist Party of India (Marxist)
notes: On 8 January, a group of around 10 labour activists stopped a school bus and attacked the bus driver by Champadali crossing in Barasat area of Delhi (Delhi) for not following the national two day labour strike against BJP policies. The man was rescued by nearby civilians. The strike was called by several groups including the CITU, INTUC, AITUC, HMS, AITUC and CPI-M.

On 8 January, chaos erupted at the University of South Africa (Unisa) Pietermaritzburg campus as protesting students blocked off a street by burning tyres, calling on management to address their demands.

On 8 Jan 2019, students from the Rural Mactumatza school demanded the Education Secretary in Tuxtla Gutierrez to publish information about the 43 students that have been disappeared. After this action, the police intervened and the students used fireworks to confront the officers who answered using tear gas. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: CITU: Centre of Indian Trade Unions; AITUC: All India Trade Union Congress; Labour Group (India); AIUTUC: All India United Trade Union Centre; INTUC: Indian National Trade Union Congress; CPI(M): Communist Party of India (Marxist)

There was also a clash with the police in the railway station, and clashes with TMC supporters.

On 7 Jan 2019, a military court sentenced two Al Shabaab militants to death after finding them guilty of killing a male clan elder who was an electoral delegate in 2016. The two AS militants were executed at the police school public square at Hamar Weyne district, Mogadishu.

On 7 Jan 2019, in Fortaleza, Ceara, suspects set fire to a driving school car in Conjunto Sao Cristovao, in Jangurussu neighborhood. The student got out unharmed, but the driver suffered burns. Motivation unknown.
On 6 January, Bathembu High School in uMzinyathi district in Msinga, northern KZN, were damaged in suspected arson attacks.

In addition to various post-demonstration arrests, 20 professors from the University of Khartoum and 3 journalists were arrested in Khartoum (coordinates used) on Jan 6th; an MP with the PCP was reportedly detained on Jan 9th, after she participated in a demonstration in Omdurman. Elewhere, an activist was rearrested in El Gedaref on January 8th, prompting a social media campaign calling for his release, whilst a nurse (who is also an activist) was arrested in El Obeid on Jan 9th.

On 6 Jan 2019, in Ariquemes, Rondonia, suspects set fire to 2 vehicles of the Municipal Secretariat of the Environment and a school bus in the garage of a transportation company. A teenager (14) was detained for these crimes on 8 Jan 2019; he confessed and said he was part of a criminal group that acts from a prison.

On January 6, two groups of students clashed in Garamur area in Jorhat city (Jorhat, Assam), when a group of boys from an adjacent village started to play cricket inside the Jorhat Engineering College campus. Two persons were injured.
On 6 January, Mvuzo High School in France township in Pietermaritzburg were damaged in suspected arson attacks.

location: Al Hudaydah - Al Hudaydah International Airport
notes: Anti-Houthi forces reportedly fired machine guns in the direction of the Hudaydah airport and College of Medicine. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

On 5 Jan 2019, in Morrinhos (CE), during the wave of attacks in the state of Ceara, rioters set fire to five school buses. The wave of attacks started after the new secretary of Penitentiary Administration, Luis Mauro Albuquerque, stated that he did not recognize criminal factions in the state of Ceara. He also said that the division of prisoners by units should not obey the logic the Government of the State had adopted - which was to distribute the inmates according to their links with criminal organizations. According to ongoing investigations, criminal factions operating in Ceara - First Capital Command (PCC, Primeiro Comando da Capital), Red Command (CV, Comando Vermelho), and Guardians of the State (GDE, Guardies do Estado) - would have joined forces to retaliate the statements made by the newly-installed state penitentiary secretary, Luis Mauro Albuquerque. [size=no report]

On 4 January 2019, some parents residing in Borj Al Aifa continued and escalated their protest by placing barricades and burning tires on road No. 5 in an attempt to put pressure on the authorities not to close a school in the area.
On January 4, a school teacher was beaten up by the locals after he was caught with a married woman in her house, in No.1 Bhelkara village in Hajo city area (Kamrup, Assam).

actor1: NSUI: National Students Union of India
notes: On 4 January, the state INSO president was attacked and injured a local youth apparently aligned with the NSUI, at Maharshi Dayanand University in Rohtak city (Rohtak, Haryana). The incident seems to have stemmed from an earlier clash between NSUI and INSO members (no details). The INSO leader was attacked with sharp weapons and lathis, as well as alleging gun shots. No details of the original clash recorded.

Around 4 January, police and farmers clashed after farmers locked a group of stray cattle up in a school in Bidhnu area of Kanpur (Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh), leaving 3 officers injured. No further details.

On January 4, students of SM College demonstrated by pelting stones at the college building in Saddar town (Karachi, Sindh) against the college administration for not issuing admit card for their annual exams.
03 January. Two men cut the throat of a university student, as they suspected his father of practicing witchcraft. The perpetrators were arrested.
On Jan 3, Israeli soldiers opened live fire and fired tear gas at Palestinian students who were leaving their school in Tell near Nablus. The reason for the attack on the students is unknown.
Week of 02 January. A school principal in Bamenyam of Galim district is kidnapped by Ambazonian separatists. He was released hours later.

On 2 Jan 2019, a Peking University student activist involved with the Jasic Workers Solidarity Group was taken away by police in Changsha City (Hunan) and was held incommunicado for at least 8 days. His detention comes after his participation in an event commemorating Mao Zedong, during which he expressed solidarity for the Jasic workers' union.
02 January: Dembi Dolo University president, Dr. Delasa Bulcha was kidnapped by unidentified armed group near Addis Ababa.

On Jan 2, Israeli forces raided a Palestinian school in the West Bank town of Tuqu near Bethlehem. Israeli soldiers fired rubber bullets, teargas and stun grenades during the raid on the school resulting in the temporary asphyxiation of some students from teargas. The reason for the raid remains unknown.
On Jan 2, Jubo League men beat up a BNP activist and teacher (Shafiqul Islam) at Tanore Kolma High School and vandalised his motorcycle in Tanore (Rajshahi).
On January 1, unidentified armed men shot dead a watchman of a government school in Janikhel town (Bannu, KP).

On January 1, in Kozhikode town (Kozhikode, Kerala), Congress activists staged a protest march to the office of the Deputy Director of Education (DDE) in protest against the half-day off declared for schools that they asserted was for mobilizing people for the government-backed women's wall. Congress workers had a minor clash with the police outside the DDE office when they tried to barge into the officials' cabin.
